p: Results obtained in the present study demonstrated indirectly the influence of pedo-climatic conditions on secondary metabolites expression, which exert an important role in the phytochemical composition of M. pulegium EOs allowed to identify two different chemotypes (pulegone/isomenthone for MPLI and MPFI EOs, and piperitone/isomenthone for MPLII, MPFII, MPLIII, and MPFIII EOs) ( Figure 5).
